Understanding WEBP and JPG Formats

WEBP is a modern image format developed by Google that offers superior compression and quality. However, not all browsers and applications support WEBP, especially older ones.

JPG/JPEG is the most widely supported image format worldwide. It works in every browser, email client, social media platform, and image editing software.

When to convert: Use this converter when you need maximum compatibility, sharing images via email, uploading to older platforms, or when your software doesn't support WEBP.

Frequently Asked Questions

Why doesn't my email show WEBP images?

Many email clients (including Outlook, some mobile email apps) don't support WEBP format. Converting to JPG ensures your images display correctly in all email applications.

Will I lose quality converting WEBP to JPG?

WEBP images converted to JPG maintain excellent quality. Both formats use lossy compression for photographs. Our converter uses high-quality settings (90% quality) to ensure minimal quality loss.

Can I convert WEBP with transparency to JPG?

Yes, but JPG doesn't support transparency. Any transparent areas in your WEBP image will be converted to white background in the JPG output. If you need to preserve transparency, use our WEBP to PNG Converter.
